Function Documentation

void initImgs (  ) 

Need before start of trackLK and at the end of the program for cleanup.

Needed before start of trackLK and at the end of the program for cleanup. Handles PYR(Pyramid cache) variable.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

int trackLK ( IplImage *  imgI,
IplImage *  imgJ,
float  ptsI[],
int  nPtsI,
float  ptsJ[],
int  nPtsJ,
int  level,
float *  fb,
float *  ncc,
char *  status 
)

Tracks Points from 1.Image to 2.Image. Need initImgs before start and at the end of the program for cleanup.

Parameters:
imgI previous Image source. (isn't changed)
imgJ actual Image target. (isn't changed)
ptsI points to track from first Image. Format [0] = x1, [1] = y1, [2] = x2 ...
nPtsI number of Points to track from first Image
ptsJ container for calculated points of second Image. Must have the length of nPtsI.
nPtsJ number of Points
level Pyramidlevel, default 5
fb forward-backward confidence value. (corresponds to euclidean distance between). Must have the length of nPtsI: nPtsI * sizeof(float).
ncc normCrossCorrelation values. needs as inputlength nPtsI * sizeof(float)
status Indicates positive tracks. 1 = PosTrack 0 = NegTrack needs as inputlength nPtsI * sizeof(char)

Based Matlab function: lk(2,imgI,imgJ,ptsI,ptsJ,Level) (Level is optional)
